content:
So I'm seeing this in the IG output: Jekyll: [n3f3img u r at i o nD efpirleec:a tCi:o/nU:s eTh e B r'ygne/mDso'c ucmoenf i sg/uSrract/iHoLn7 /oSppti coinf ihcaast iboens/CQL/Specifications/DSTU-Updates/R1.3/Source/temp/_config.yml
en renamed (26.0419sec)
And then the Jekyll process just hangs.
Hoping someone recognizes that particular pattern of mangling and can point me in the right direction?
Yeah, it was working fine, then I tried to change the IG's canonical URL and now I get that.
I must have changed something else though too because changing it back didn't help.
look at the string... that's internal corruption....
Reverted all my changes and I'm back to functional.
I've got a "specification" element in my ig.json, but I don't see that element documented in the IG Publisher Documentation.
I'm assuming that should just point to the specification base URL, right (i.e. http://hl7.org/fhir)?
N/m, found it, yes, it should point to the fhir base URL, but for the fhirPath ig, it's pointing to http://hl7.org/fhirpath.
should still point to the FHIR spec - it just doesn't matter for FHIRPath
